content_blocks_page.title: Let work find you
content_blocks_page.content: Labourers. chippies. sparkies. movers. shakers. foremen. apprentices. plumbers. concreters. riggers. painters. plasterers. specialists.

content_blocks_page.title: A new way to work.
content_blocks_page.subheading: Create your live profile and let the jobs find you.

bullets.bullet: No resume or cover letter uploads

repeater.tagline: We guide you through a profile generator with the exact information employers need.

bullets.bullet: Search jobs or let the jobs find you

repeater.tagline: Your mates can’t always find you the best work.  Build Labour can.

questions.title: What is Build Labour?
questions.answer: An app for companies and workers in site construction roles.  We match the right workers with the right jobs.  Think of us as a mate with lots more jobs and lots more labour options.

questions.title: How much does it cost?
questions.answer: Nothing.  Just spend some time posting your profile using our worker template and then you’ll be found by hundreds of employers.

questions.title: Who’s it for?
questions.answer: Just for the construction community.  No one else.  So all we focus on is site construction roles, including finding jobs, workers and industry training to help your career.

questions.title: Why should I use it?
questions.answer: Who doesn’t want to work in a location or role which suits them most?  Don’t limit yourself to any old role, find one which is best for you.  And all for free.

questions.title: Are my job applications kept private
questions.answer: Absolutely. Privacy is paramount. Your application is strictly between you and the companies. We’re very discreet.

questions.title: Do I need an ABN?
questions.answer: Maybe. Maybe not. It depends on the specific job relationship with the employer.  Some jobs require one and others don’t.  There’s lots of choice.

questions.title: Do I need my own insurance?
questions.answer: Same as for an ABN. If you’re a subby, you will. If you’re being hired as an employee you won’t.
